item.title: Report E-2023060514
item.description:
Report E-2023060514

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-04
  • City: LAKELAND
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 04, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon jug of UN3098 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Alpha-Omega Training and Compliance (AOTC) to remediate the impacted site. AOTC personnel deployed neutralizing agent and worked it in using hand tools. The crew then utilized absorbent pads to remove any residual product from the impacted surfaces. AOTC patched the damaged 5-gallon pail and overpacked it into one (1) 30-gallon drum for disposal. All UN3098 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023060429
item.description:
Report E-2023060429

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-01
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NOF experienced a UN3267 "Sikadur-42 Grout-Pak Part B" release from (6) 5-gallon poly pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 5' x 5' area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. A total of 6 pails of product were found empty and placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. All impacted absorbents were containerized into (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023060554
item.description:
Report X-2023060554

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-01
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The unprocessed box was found wet in the load area and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: Contents were leaking from under the cap on one of the jugs in the box, even though the cap was on tight. The label on the box had a 96220302 service code on it. The service code in the system is 96220019. The contents in the box and the OP-909 are different than HESS. The contents are actually 100% Reagent Alcohol, (Ethanol Solutions, UN1170, II, Flammable Liquid). Ftrack has no hazmat information listed. These items were mentioned in the second ISP entered. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed upright in a hazbag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023060639
item.description:
Report X-2023060639

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-26
  • City: COCOA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS NOT PROPERLY PACKED OR MARKED ACCORDING TO DOT REGULATION. THERE WERE NO DIRECTIONAL ARROWS TO BE FOLLOWED. THE LID WAS LOOSE AND THIS CAUSED INTERNAL LEAKAGE. WHEN DISCOVERED BY UNLOADER THEY ALLERTED QA AND THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE AND PLACED IN A VENTILATED AREA . DescribePack: THE LID SEAL WAS COMPROMISED CAUSING THE CONTENT TO LEAK INTERNAL. THE CONTENT WAS SMOKING AND EMMITING A STRONG ODOR. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE TO CONTAIN AND STOP FURTHER LEAKING. IT WAS PLACED IN A VENTILATED AREA .

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: On May 18, 2023, two (2) 1-gallon pails of UN1789 were punctured by an adjacent pallet and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. HES personnel overpacked the two (2) damaged 1-gallon pails in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew then deployed granular absorbents and hand tools to containerize all UN1789 impacted material in the same 55-gallon drum for disposal.
